p: Ganapaty et al. studied the diuretic activity of the aqueous extract of the aerial parts of C. hirsutus in normap mice and the extract at a dose of 100 and 200 mg/kg, p.o. showed significant increase in the urinary concentrations of Na + and K + suggesting potent diuretic activity [ 67]. Badole et al. carried out the acute and chronic diuretic activity of the ethanolic extract of leaves of C. hirsutus in normal rats and the extract significantly increased the urinary concentrations of Na + and K + [ 68]. Gadapuram et al. reported the potent nephroprotective activity of the ethanolic extract of the leaves of C. hirsutus in 5/6 nephrectomized rat model [ 69].
